newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks dragged down by two banks.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks dragged down by two banks.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks were marginally lower in early Friday trading, due to declines in two highly capitalised banking blue chips which are involved in a possible merger, brokers said.
The all share index was 0.76 points down at 605.97 at the mid-morning break, on turnover of 12.16 million rupees.
Commercial Bank and Hatton National Bank shares fell eight rupees each to 125 and 265 rupees respectively.
"Overall, there is buying interest. The index was dragged down mainly by falls in HNB and Commercial after yesterday's merger story," said Shanil Perera, a broker at Lanka Securities.
Commercial Bank said on Thursday that Hatton National Bank (HNB) and Development Finance Corporation (DFCC) had bid for a 40 percent stake of its equity.
"Commercial Bank is down because a newspaper said HNB had bid only 103 rupees a share," said a broker who declined to be identified.
HNB was down due to a lack of buyers, who felt that DFCC had a better chance of getting the 40 percent stake, he said.
